description.text: RNA Secondary Structure Prediction and Comparison.

doc.title: RNAplfold

description.text: Compute average pair probabilities for local base pairs in long sequences

doc.authors: Stephan H Bernhart, Ivo L Hofacker, Peter F Stadler.
doc.reference: S. H. Bernhart, I.L. Hofacker, and P.F. Stadler (2006) "Local Base Pairing Probabilities in Large RNAs" Bioinformatics 22: 614-615
A.F. Bompfunewerer, R. Backofen, S.H. Bernhart, J. Hertel, I.L. Hofacker, P.F. Stadler, S. Will (2007) "Variations on {RNA} Folding and Alignment: Lessons from Benasque" J. Math. Biol.

comment.text: RNAplfold computes local pair probabilities for base pairs with a maximal span of L. The probabilities are averaged over all windows of size L that contain the base pair.
Output consists of a dot plot in postscript file, where the averaged pair probabilities can easily be parsed and visually inspected.

xhtml:div.label: Size of windows for average pair probabilities. (-W)
Allow only pairs (i,j) with j-i<=span. (-L)
Report only base pairs with an average probability > cutoff. (-c)
Length to compute the mean probability of unpaired base. (-u)
Rescale energy parameters to a temperature of temperature Celcius (-T)
Do not include special stabilizing energies for certain tetraloops (-4) Yes No

How to treat dangling end energies for bases adjacent to helices in free ends and multiloops (-d)?
Only unpaired bases can participate in at most one dangling end (-d1) Ignores dangling ends altogether (-d) The check is ignored, this is the default for partition function folding (-d2)
How to treat 'dangling end' energies for bases adjacent to helices in free ends and multiloops: Normally only unpaired bases can participate in at most one dangling end. With -d2 this check is ignored, this is the default for partition function folding (-p). -d ignores dangling ends altogether. Note that by default pf and mfe folding treat dangling ends differently, use -d2 (or -d) in addition to -p to ensure that both algorithms use the same energy model. The -d2 options is available for RNAfold, RNAeval, and RNAinverse only.
Do not allow GU pairs (-noGU) Yes No
Do not allow GU pairs at the end of helices (-noCloseGU) Yes No

Non standard pairs (comma seperated list) (-nsp)?
Allow other pairs in addition to the usual AU,GC,and GU pairs. pairs is a comma seperated list of additionally allowed pairs. If a the first character is a '-' then AB will imply that AB and BA are allowed pairs. e.g. RNAfold -nsp -GA will allow GA and AG pairs. Nonstandard pairs are given 0 stacking energy.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Read energy parameters from paramfile, instead of using the default parameter set. A sample parameterfile should accompany your distribution. See the RNAlib documentation for details on the file format.

xhtml:div.label:
Output is switched from probabilities to their logarithm?
Yes No
Toggles -u option, output is switched from probabilities to their logarithm, which are NOT exactly the mean energies needed to the respective stretch of bases!

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: How to treat 'dangling end' energies for bases adjacent to helices in free ends and multiloops: Normally only unpaired bases can participate in at most one dangling end. With -d2 this check is ignored, this is the default for partition function folding (-p). -d ignores dangling ends altogether. Note that by default pf and mfe folding treat dangling ends differently, use -d2 (or -d) in addition to -p to ensure that both algorithms use the same energy model. The -d2 options is available for RNAfold, RNAeval, and RNAinverse only.

Allow other pairs in addition to the usual AU,GC,and GU pairs. pairs is a comma seperated list of additionally allowed pairs. If a the first character is a '-' then AB will imply that AB and BA are allowed pairs. e.g. RNAfold -nsp -GA will allow GA and AG pairs. Nonstandard pairs are given 0 stacking energy.

Read energy parameters from paramfile, instead of using the default parameter set. A sample parameterfile should accompany your distribution. See the RNAlib documentation for details on the file format.
Toggles -u option, output is switched from probabilities to their logarithm, which are NOT exactly the mean energies needed to the respective stretch of bases!

parameter.name: winsize
parameter.prompt: Size of windows for average pair probabilities. (-W)

format.code: ( "" , " -W " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label: Size of windows for average pair probabilities. (-W)

format.code: ( "" , " -L " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value <= winsize ]

parameter.name: cutoff
parameter.prompt: Report only base pairs with an average probability > cutoff. (-c)

format.code: ( "" , " -c " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label: Report only base pairs with an average probability > cutoff. (-c)

parameter.name: width
parameter.prompt: Length to compute the mean probability of unpaired base. (-u)

interface.label: Length to compute the mean probability of unpaired base. (-u)

parameter.name: temperature
parameter.prompt: Rescale energy parameters to a temperature of temperature Celcius (-T)

format.code: ( "" , " -T " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

interface.label: Rescale energy parameters to a temperature of temperature Celcius (-T)

parameter.name: tetraloops
parameter.prompt: Do not include special stabilizing energies for certain tetraloops (-4)

interface.label: Do not include special stabilizing energies for certain tetraloops (-4) Yes No

parameter.name: dangling
parameter.prompt: How to treat dangling end energies for bases adjacent to helices in free ends and multiloops (-d)

velem.label: Only unpaired bases can participate in at most one dangling end (-d1)
The check is ignored, this is the default for partition function folding (-d2)

format.code: ( "" , " " + str(value) )[ value is not None and value != vdef]

comment.text: How to treat 'dangling end' energies for bases adjacent to helices in free ends and multiloops: Normally only unpaired bases can participate in at most one dangling end. With -d2 this check is ignored, this is the default for partition function folding (-p). -d ignores dangling ends altogether. Note that by default pf and mfe folding treat dangling ends differently, use -d2 (or -d) in addition to -p to ensure that both algorithms use the same energy model. The -d2 options is available for RNAfold, RNAeval, and RNAinverse only.

interface.label:

With -d2 this check is ignored, this is the default for partition function folding (-p). -d ignores dangling ends altogether. Note that by default pf and mfe folding treat dangling ends differently, use -d2 (or -d) in addition to -p to ensure that both algorithms use the same energy model. The -d2 options is available for RNAfold, RNAeval, and RNAinverse only.

format.code: "/local/gensoft/libexec/ViennaRNA/readseq -f=19 -a "+ str(seq) + " > "+ str(seq) +".tmp && (cp "+ str(seq) +" "+ str(seq) +".orig && mv "+ str(seq) +".tmp "+ str(seq) +") ; "
